author: NFT-DAO (the whole team)
title: NFT-DAO EZ-Pay API wallet connector
description: Connecting to wallets, payment gateways, exchanges & credit cards in Web3 is not as simple as it has become with Stripe-like Web2 solutions.

assessments.note: Seems like a useful addition to the developer toolkit.

I can see the importance of a payment system within an NFT framework.  It will certainly streamline the development process. Any NFT framework will want a streamlined payment option available to accept widely used payment methods for auctions and sales. The proposers do a good job of explaining this need. It is a challenging gap to fill and it would be wasteful if every project had to develop a payment framework independently.

This proposal addresses Cardano Fund 5: Developer Ecosystem Challenge. The project proposal is solid and can impact many developers seeking to build or integrate payment API on their platform using the Cardano Blockchain. The problem and solution in the proposal are well described and explained. This proposal, if implemented correctly, will increase Cardano Blockchain within the developer community.
The team has the experience to deliver this project.
This is not an easy challenge, but the team and the support of the greater NFT-DAO community make it feasible in my eyes. In other words, if anyone is likely to succeed, it is this team.

It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because it includes a straightforward plan which will serve the adaption of Cardano Blockchain by developers. This proposal is highly feasible as it encompasses a strongly diverse skilled team with the skillset to build an APIs solution on top of the Cardano Platform which will facilitate the payment connection between multiple wallets and gateways.
Nice project bringing deeded functional to the dev ecosystem.

I wish a more detailed breakdown of the use of funds was provided, but I realize the exact trajectory of the project is not easy to predict. Still, the proposal would benefit from a detailed rationale as to how they came to the 70K number, and how funds will be allocated in each stage.  As it is, we can follow github and expect an MVP in 3 months and a functioning product in 6 months.  Due to a lack of additional details or reporting, It will be difficult to audit how efficiently the funds are used. I suggest, if funded, they improve their transparency in this respect.
assessments.reply: I understand the desire for detailed financials, however this is a proposal where we are giving an estimate, not a quote where we would workout all the man hours to the penny.  The rationale is we will need a good six months of core developer time and without a comprehensive breakdown of exactly what we will need to do to make this a reality, we have to use rough estimates.  A typical Dev month is $10K-$15K and with 6-months of work you can see $70K is a conservative number.  The CAs should have enough experience reviewing a technical proposal to understand the standard reasonable cost structure for a development project so they can assess if it is within bounds of reality.  If not, then perhaps they aren't in a good position to take on this kind of proposal.  Since we are recieving a low mark on this basis, I think it should be strongly considered what criteria we are using to judge the proposal.  This is about making it easy for developers in our ecosystem.

assessments.note: The information provided in the Roadmap is sufficient to track and audit the project progress. The milestones are included in the detailed phasis. The big question to address is by when can we expect the delivery of this project?
assessments.reply: Answered: 6-month: The MVP API will be active in General Availability (GA) and Fully Operational (FO).

solution: Build extended wallet bridges to traditional systems like VISA, Venmo and a hub for things like MetaMask, Yoroi, Daedalus & exchanges.
experience: **MuKn.io/Glow** brings skills of cybersecurity, cryptography, distributed systems, systems programming, economic modeling & mechanism design.
